result.execSummary:
The defendant Mack M. Butler III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney T Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 3 years WSP consecutive to Dane County 12CF1610; 1 year initial confinement (no credit); 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is not eligible for CIP; deft is eligible for SAP; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney T Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 6/2/15 at 2pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Terry Rose.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  At request of Atty Rose, pretrial adj. to 5/29/15 at 8:30.  Bond continued.  D.A. to writ def. from Dodge Correctional.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney T Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, FPT continued to 5/8/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Atty T Rose appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft was not writted from Dodge Correctional.  ADA McNeill wants to discuss case w/Detective before resolution.  FPT continued to 5/4/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney T Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Rose states he believes the ADA will be reviewing the case w/the Detective involved in the case.  FPT continued to 3/24/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney T Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Rose states the case is not resolved but believes ADA McNeill wants to discuss credit with DA Zapf.  ADA McNeill agrees.  FPT continued to 3/2/15 at 2pm.  Bond continued.
With Atty Rose and by approval of the court the FPT of 2/10/15 at 8:30am is rescheduled to 2/11/15 at 8:15am.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney T Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, FPT continued to 2/10/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
